Name: Metabase
Description from awesome list: Easy, open-source way for everyone in your company to ask questions and learn from data.
Description from NIX Search: The easy, open source way for everyone in your company to ask questions and learn from data
Specs:
Java: Install Java 11.
Application: Download and run the Metabase JAR file or use the Docker image.
Database: Use PostgreSQL or MySQL/MariaDB for the application database. Avoid using the default H2 database for production.
Memory & CPU: Allocate 1 CPU core and 1 GB RAM per 20 concurrent users for the application server. Allocate 1 CPU core and 2 GB RAM for the database server, scaling as needed.
Storage: Allocate at least 10 GB for the application database.
OS: Metabase runs on Linux, macOS, and Windows (using Docker).
License: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0 only

Name: ArchiveBox
Description from awesome list: Self-hosted wayback machine that creates HTML & screenshot archives of sites from your bookmarks, browsing history, RSS feeds, or other sources.
Description from NIX Search: Open source self-hosted web archiving
Specs:
Supported Systems


macOS: Version 10.12 and above, using Homebrew.
Linux: Distributions like Ubuntu and Debian, using apt.
BSD: FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD, using pkg.

Other systems like Windows (via Docker, Docker in WSL2, or directly with pip) and various other Linux distributions (Fedora, SUSE, Arch, CentOS) are not officially supported but are likely to work with some adjustments.

Hardware Requirements

RAM: Minimum 500MB (bare minimum), 2GB or more recommended.
Storage: Use a filesystem with compression and/or deduplication abilities (e.g., ZFS or BTRFS) for maximum archive storage efficiency.

Software Dependencies
Python: Version 3.7 or higher.
Chromium: Version 59 or higher (Google Chrome version 59 or higher also works).
wget: Version 1.16 or higher.
curl
git
youtube-dl
Node.js: Version 18 or higher if using certain optional features.

Proxmox Virtual Environment Requirements

Storage:
OS Storage: Hardware RAID with BBU or non-RAID with ZFS and SSD cache.
VM Storage: Hardware RAID with BBU or non-RAID for ZFS. SSDs recommended.
Network: Redundant Gbit NICs; 10 Gbit and higher supported.
PCI(e) Passthrough: CPU with VT-d/AMD-d flag.

Minimum Hardware (for Testing):

CPU: 64bit (Intel EMT64 or AMD64).
Memory: Minimum 1 GB RAM.
Storage: Hard drive.
Network: One NIC.
Storage Options: Local (DAS), SAN, NAS, shared, and distributed storage (Ceph).

File System Support: Compatible with ext4, XFS, or Btrfs.
Kerberos: Configure either Heimdal or MIT Kerberos in /etc/krb5.conf.
Time Synchronization: Use an NTP client for synchronized time.
Host Name Resolution: Proper DNS setup or correct /etc/hosts entries.
